poem:
### Thresholds

In the cold corridors of power,  
a pen's stroke  
sharpens the world's edge,  
lowering thresholds  
like a winter sun.  
Words crafted in silence,  
echoing louder than missiles,  
while earth waits,  
holding its breath  
against whispers of steel  
and fragility's shadow  
hanging,  
like a question mark  
in a trembling sky.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The revised nuclear doctrine declares that a conventional attack on Russia by any nation that is supported by a nuclear power will be considered". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
